5. (3, 1) - Far away

- The apple at (7, 3) is the closest and directly adjacent
- The apple at (9, 3) is also right next to me
- Enemy snake at (3, 3) is not an immediate threat
- No risk of wall collision with nearby moves

Optimal First Move:
- I'll go for the apple at (7, 3), which is to my LEFT
- This allows me to immediately gain a point and grow my snake
- No risk of collision with walls or other snakes

Next Turn Strategy:
- After eating this apple, I'll look to position myself near other close apples
- Keep track of enemy snake's movements
- Avoid potential collision paths

– We cannot go UP; our tail is still at (3, 2) because we just grew, so that square is occupied.
– LEFT to (2, 1) or DOWN to (3, 0) are safe but take us no closer to any apples.

Thinking:
– Legal moves from (4,1):  
  • UP → (4,2) (safe but puts us on a collision course with enemy for the (6,2) apple)  
  • DOWN → (4,0) (safe but drifts away from every apple)  
  • LEFT → (3,1) (safe only because our tail would vacate, but takes us backward)  
  • RIGHT → (5,1) (safe, keeps distance from enemy head, and lets us curve toward the eastern apples)

– Enemy snake at (5,3) is almost certainly targeting the (6,2) apple.  
  If we go UP now we risk a head-to-head tie next turn.  
  Sliding along the bottom (RIGHT) lets the enemy have that apple while we stay alive and set up for the cluster at (8,4) and (9,3).

Self-reminder for next turn:
From (5,1) look to continue RIGHT to (6,1) or turn UP once the enemy commits north of us. Keep an exit square open and avoid getting pinned against the bottom-right corner.

0.rationale:
Thinking:
Current head: (5,1)

Legal moves
• UP → (5,2) safe, but puts us directly in the enemy’s downward path if they chase the (6,2) apple.  
• DOWN → (5,0) safe, but drifts into the dead-end bottom row and away from every apple.  
• LEFT → (4,1) legal (tail vacates) but just reverses last turn.  
• RIGHT → (6,1) safe, keeps bottom escape lane, and sets us one step from the (6,2) apple.

Enemy outlook
Enemy head at (5,4) almost certainly moves DOWN toward (6,2).  
If we slide RIGHT now, we arrive beside the apple first; next turn we can pop UP to (6,2) and eat it before the enemy can reach us.  
Meanwhile we still have retreat squares (5,1) and (6,0) open in case the enemy surprises us.

Plan for next turn
Assuming we land on (6,1) safely, look to:
1. UP to (6,2) for the apple if the enemy is not already at (5,2) or (6,2).  
2. Otherwise, bail RIGHT along the bottom edge to avoid a head-to-head.
